intro: Diphysa paucifoliolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed diphysa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Diphysa paucifoliolata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with partial shade.
